result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D. Taft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling as deemed appropriate, which may include AODA

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Report no later than 6:00 pm on 5-5-16

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D. Taft

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua D. Taft in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:03 a.m. Agreement stated - Subject to plea, State will move to amend to disorderly conduct 947.01(1) without dom enhancer, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling as deemed necessary, court costs, 5 days jail. Atty Laufenberg agrees. State has complied with VWNR and has filed victim impact statement. Def understands and agrees. Court reviews plea quest. Court grants motion to amend to simple disorderly conduct. No contest plea. Consitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of disorderly conduct. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, counseling as deemed appropriate, which may include AODA, 5 days jail, report no later than 6 p.m. on 5/5/16, huber, no credit if revoked. No DNA sample or surcharge ordered. Court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. No restitution requested by State. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Joshua D. Taft in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:41 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. No resolution at this time. Off the record 9:42. Back on the record 9:43. Def advised will most likely be #1 for trial on 3/9/16. Proposed jury instructions due 1 week in advance.

Defendant Joshua D. Taft in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:16 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Def must appear at final pre-trial. Bond remains.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua D. Taft in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:35 pm. State is ready to proceed. Atty Laufenberg waives p.h. Def. waives p.h.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information filed. Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Joshua D. Taft in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 9:09 a.m. Copy of complaint received, reading waived. Request ph but waive time limits. Def agrees. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua D. Taft
Current: W7775 State Highway 47, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2015)
Prior: 618.5  5th Ave., Antigo, WI 54409
No use of alcohol.   No contact with C. J.

Defendant Joshua D. Taft in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received,  def waives reviewing by court.  Court instructs def of right to an atty.  Def request an atty.   State request signature bond with conditions.  Bond set  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
